title: Haudenosaunee Confederacy: Democratic Practices Predating US Constitution
summary: The Haudenosaunee (Iroquois) Confederacy demonstrated sophisticated democratic practices, including consensus-based decision-making, gender-balanced leadership, and a complex system of checks and balances that significantly influenced the design of the United States Constitution. Benjamin Franklin and other Founding Fathers extensively studied the Haudenosaunee political system.

sources.title: Exemplar of Democracy: The Haudenosaunee Constitution
